tutorials.title: Voice Production Workflow
tutorials.description: Learn to manage voice recordings, assign audio to dialogue lines, and configure voice localization.
tutorials.author: NovelMind Team

steps.title: Voice Manager
steps.content: The Voice Manager maps audio files to dialogue lines. It organizes recordings by character and language.

steps.title: Adding Languages
steps.content: First, add the languages you need. Click 'Add Locale' and select your target languages.

steps.title: Voice File Tree
steps.content: The tree shows all dialogue lines organized by character. Click on a line to assign or preview its voice file.

steps.title: Assigning Audio
steps.content: Drag an audio file from the Asset Browser onto a dialogue line, or click 'Browse' to select a file.

steps.title: Preview Playback
steps.content: Click the play button next to any line to preview its voice recording.

steps.title: Export for Voice Actors
steps.content: Export a CSV with all unrecorded lines for your voice actors. They can record and return the files.

tutorials.title: Audio Mixer Basics
tutorials.description: Balance your game's audio with the mixer panel. Control music, voice, and sound effects levels.
tutorials.author: NovelMind Team

steps.title: Audio Mixer
steps.content: The Audio Mixer lets you balance different audio channels: Music, Voice, SFX, Ambient, UI, and Dialogue.

steps.title: Audio Channels
steps.content: Each channel has its own volume slider. The Master slider affects all channels at once.

steps.title: Auto-Ducking
steps.content: Enable ducking to automatically lower music volume when dialogue plays. Great for voice clarity.

hints.content: Add a locale to enable voice production for that language.
Drag audio files here to assign voice recordings to dialogue lines.
